channel.title: Building a computer :P
channel.description: Im building a computer :D ill post pics once i get the parts and start assembling it. So far i got 16gb of ram 4 tb of sstorage(2 western digital caviar green hard drives.) The intel i7 2600k processor, an asus p8p67 pro motherboard ,the creative labs SoundBlaster X-FI Titanium Fatal1ty Pro sound card, the cooler master haf 932 full tower case, windows 7 ultimate(64bit), the Hydro h60 liquid cooler, and a 1000w power supply. Sometime next month ill be getting a blu ray cd drive, radeon 6970 graphics card, a keyboard,mouse, and some other things. What do you guys think of this build :D?

item.title: Building a computer :P
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:20, topic:398622”]Oh, yeah, forgot to mention, you should probably sacrifice some of the money you’re spending on one of your hard drives and get a solid state drive instead to boot windows and programs from, possibly a 64gb one, it’ll be worth the money.

And agreed with above, 16gb of RAM is unnecessary, 8gb is perfectly alright.[/quote]

It’s what I’ve got. 320 GB HDD, Radeon HD 4890, Intel Q9550. Nothing fancy.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a computer :P
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Oh, yeah, forgot to mention, you should probably sacrifice some of the money you’re spending on one of your hard drives and get a solid state drive instead to boot windows and programs from, possibly a 64gb one, it’ll be worth the money.

And agreed with above, 16gb of RAM is unnecessary, 8gb is perfectly alright.

item.title: Building a computer :P
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

You’re spending way more money than is required. You’re not going to be using 16 GB of RAM, nor 4 TB of Hard Drive space.

Why do people always insist on buying the “biggest and baddest” of everything? All of your components will be considered out-dated in a month.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a computer :P
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Honestly your best performance/value ratio would definitely be best with the 2x GTX560’s, it definitely kicks a single 570 out the window and two of the 560’s is practically the same price as a single 570. Also 2 560’s outweighs the performance of one 580, and probably the 590 though I’m not too sure on that.

Read full topic

When i’m done i think i might host/own an rsps for the experience :D. This summer is going to be epic ;D

item.title: Building a computer :P
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Just make sure all your hardware is compatible… that would be a silly thing to get wrong, speed of RAM must be be compatible with processor, cpu must have same socket type as motherboard etc. Just checking you know

Read full topic

item.title: Building a computer :P
item.dc:creator: @risinglight risinglight
item.description:
@risinglight wrote:

item.title: Building a computer :P
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

risinglight:

Thanks java , i appreciate all the feedback and suggestions what about 2 gtx 570’s?

It would definitely be better yes, but it’s whether it’s worth paying the extra 200 quid or so just for that, when the 2 gtx 560’s would max out all games (with the exception of maybe metro 2033) with a smooth 60+ fps. It’s not really necessary for you to buy more when you probably will not notice a difference.

Read full topic
